Upcoming Sri Lanka-Bangladesh two-match Test series will be Silverwood's first assignment. "I'm very excited to be on board with Sri Lanka...I cannot wait to get over to Colombo and get started," said Silverwood.

176.title: India Meteorological Dept's Twitter account hacked, link to NFT drop shared
176.article_body: The official Twitter handle of India Meteorological Department (IMD) was hacked on Saturday. Hackers removed the profile picture and name from the account. They shared a link to an NFT (non-fungible token) airdrop of the "Beanz Official Collection". Earlier today, the account of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office was briefly hacked and its profile picture was changed to 'Bored Ape'.

177.title: Better.com, which fired 900 staff over a Zoom call, plans to cut its staff further
177.article_body: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which fired 900 employees over a Zoom call last year and began firing 3,000 India and US employees last month, plans to cut its workforce further. It's offering some employees as much as 60 days of severance pay and health insurance if they agree to quit. A Better.com spokesperson confirmed the voluntary separation offers to Bloomberg.

178.title: Manchester City-Liverpool PL game biggest of the season: Foden
178.article_body: Ahead of Manchester City-Liverpool Premier League match, Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden said it's the "biggest game" that every footballer wants to play in. "Two teams fighting for the Premier League, very close on points," he added. Table-toppers Manchester City are on 73 points, with just one point lead over second-placed Liverpool. The match will be played on Sunday.

179.title: Decade-old Hindu temple vandalised in Jammu, case registered
179.article_body: A decade-old temple on the outskirts of Jammu was allegedly vandalised by unidentified miscreants on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday, prompting police to file a case. The temple priest noticed the damage caused to the idols in the morning. Police urged people to maintain communal harmony and foil designs of those trying to disturb the peace.

180.title: UK PM Boris Johnson meets Ukraine President Zelenskyy in Kyiv, pic surfaces
180.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a visit to Kyiv on Saturday. The embassy of Ukraine in London shared a photo of the two leaders meeting face to face, with the caption, "Surprise." "Boris Johnson's visit in Kyiv began just now with a tete-a-tete meeting with President Zelenskyy," an aide of Ukraine President said on Facebook.

181.title: All institutions in hands of RSS, we have to protect them: Rahul
181.article_body: During a book launch event in Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday alleged that all institutions in India are in the hands of the RSS. He said, "We've to protect the Constitution...To save the Constitution, we've to protect our institutions...But all the institutions are in...hands of RSS." Earlier, Rahul had said that Opposition parties must unite to fight BJP.

182.title: Video shows speeding BMW hitting woman on 2-wheeler after jumping divider in Mangaluru
182.article_body: A CCTV footage has emerged which shows a speeding BMW car jumping over a divider and hitting a woman on a two-wheeler and crashing into another car in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. The video shows another woman, who was standing on the divider, narrowly escaping from being hit by the speeding car. The woman on the two-wheeler suffered critical injuries.

183.title: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc claims pole position in Aus GP qualifying
183.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc on Saturday took pole position ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen's teammate Sergio Perez finished third ahead of McLaren's Lando Norris in fourth. Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton came fifth with teammate George Russell finishing sixth. "We are again very close with Red Bull," said Leclerc.

184.title: Warnock retires from football aged 73 after 42-year managerial career
184.article_body: Former Queens Park Rangers, Crystal Palace and Sheffield United manager Neil Warnock on Saturday, announced his retirement from football, at the age of 73, after a 42-year managerial career. Warnock has managed more matches in English professional football than anyone else with over 1,600 games. He began his managerial career in 1980. "I've had a good run really," he said.

185.title: Over 44 lakh people fled Ukraine since start of war, says UN
185.article_body: More than 44 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of the war in February, according to the UN refugee agency. Of these, around 2.1 lakh are non-Ukrainians. Around 90% of those who have fled Ukraine are women and children, as the Ukrainian authorities do not allow men of military age to leave, according to AFP.

186.title: Mumbai Police records Sanjay Raut's statement in phone tapping case
186.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Saturday recorded the statement on senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut at the office of the party's mouthpiece Saamna. Raut is one of the two politicians whose phones were allegedly tapped illegally by the Maharashtra Intelligence Department when IPS officer Rashmi Shukla was its chief. The recording lasted for nearly one hour, a police officer said.

187.title: Didn't really feel good in the car: Max Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
187.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen said he "didn't really feel good in the car" as he finished second behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the qualifying session of the Australian Grand Prix on Saturday. "I think there's not been one lap where I actually felt confident, a bit of a struggle," Verstappen said ahead of the Grand Prix on Sunday.

188.title: Boris Becker found guilty of four charges in bankruptcy trial in London
188.article_body: Six-time Grand Slam champion Boris Becker was found guilty of four charges in his bankruptcy trial in London after being accused of hiding millions of pounds worth of assets including two Wimbledon trophies to avoid paying debts. Becker, 54, was acquitted of further 20 counts. He was made bankrupt on June 21, 2017. Becker had previously denied the charges.

189.title: Employees shouldn't feel pressured to answer emails late at night: Nadella
189.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has said that managers need to set clear norms and expectations for workers so they're not pressured to answer emails late at night. "We know what stress does to workers. We need to learn the soft skills," he added. When asked if he refrains from sending emails on the weekend, Nadella said, "I'm learning every day."

190.title: IT firm Kissflow gifts BMWs to 5 senior employees to honour their loyalty
190.article_body: Chennai-based IT firm Kissflow has gifted BMW cars worth over ₹1 crore each to five of its senior employees to honour their loyalty and commitment to the company. Kissflow CEO Suresh Sambandam said these employees have been with him right from the company's inception. Some of them hail from humble background and underwent various challenges before joining Kissflow, Sambandam added.

191.title: Hats off to determination: Jay on India's win vs Netherlands in Pro League
191.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter to congratulate India after they defeated reigning world and Olympic champions Netherlands 2-1 in the first match of their double leg tie at FIH Women's Pro Hockey League on Friday. "Hats off to the determination of team India to come out on top," he wrote. Navneet Kaur was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

192.title: Tourists visiting J&K due to CRPF's hard work, says Home Secy
192.article_body: Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Saturday said it's due to the hard work of CRPF that many tourists are visiting J&K and that there's a sense of security in the Union Territory. Bhalla also praised security forces for neutralising "many hardcore terrorists" in J&K over the past year. A huge quantity of arms were also seized, he added.

193.title: SRH register biggest win by wickets in IPL 2022, CSK lose 4th match in a row
193.article_body: SRH registered their first win in IPL 2022 by defeating CSK by eight wickets on Saturday. It is the biggest win by wickets in the tournament so far. CSK have now lost four matches in a row. SRH opener Abhishek Sharma top-scored in the match with 75(50) as SRH chased down the 155-run target in 17.4 overs.

194.title: RCB to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash, Glenn Maxwell returns
194.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against winless MI in their IPL 2022 clash. RCB have made one change to their playing XI, with Glenn Maxwell replacing Sherfane Rutherford. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jaydev Unadkat replacing Tymal Mills and Ramandeep Singh replacing Daniel Sams.

195.title: What is a US green card that Rishi Sunak admitted he held as UK Finance Minister?
195.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak admitted that he held a US green card for over 18 months after becoming a UK government minister. Officially known as the Permanent Resident Card, a green card grants foreign nationals the right to live and work permanently in the United States. A green card holder is considered a resident of US for tax purposes.

196.title: 132 tortured bodies found in town freed from Russian forces: Ukraine
196.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has accused Russian forces of leaving behind "tormented bodies" in the town of Makariv in the Kyiv region. It said that as Ukrainian rescuers are advancing in areas liberated by Russian forces, new "war crimes are [being] uncovered". "The town of Makariv is half-ruined. 132 tormented bodies of tortured, murdered citizens have already been found," it said.

197.title: MSRTC worker found dead near bus depot in Mumbai
197.article_body: A 43-year-old bus conductor of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), identified as Mahesh Lal, was found dead near the Parel Bus Depot in Mumbai. He had come to Mumbai from Kolhapur a few days ago to participate in the agitation outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's house. Police don't suspect foul play but have registered a case of accidental death.

198.title: Mock drills conducted in Delhi to counter terrorist attacks
198.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that security agencies conducted mock drills in the national capital to counter terrorist attacks. Police said that the mega counter-terror mock drill was named 'Exercise All Out' and was executed at multiple locations. The police stated that there will be simulated terror attacks at various markets, institutions and offices across Delhi.

199.title: Sri Lanka's Opp'n threats no-trust vote against govt amid crisis
199.article_body: Sri Lanka's main opposition party on Friday said that it would move a no-confidence motion against the government if it does not take measures to address the severe economic crisis in the country. "We have called a meeting with all opposition leaders and will take a final decision on it soon," Sajith Premadasa, chief of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), said.

200.title: Had I not conceded runs, wouldn't have got chance to hit sixes: GT's Tewatia
200.article_body: Following GT's six-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he wouldn't have got the chance to hit sixes in final two balls against PBKS if he hadn't conceded 24 runs in his single over. Tewatia scored a 3-ball 13*. GT are the only team who haven't lost a match in IPL 2022 so far.

201.title: Don't know which one of our cousins refused to give shoes to Babar Azam: Umar Akmal
201.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan captain Babar Azam claiming a cousin once refused to lend him shoes during his formative years in cricket, Umar Akmal, one of Babar's cousins, said, "I've no idea which cousin refused to give shoes to Babar." He added, "We've always offered support to relatives who wanted to play cricket. I've never turned down a request."

202.title: Leone shares her wedding pic, says 'opened wedding envelopes to pay for reception'
202.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone took to Instagram to share a picture from her wedding to celebrate her 11th marriage anniversary with Daniel Weber. In the caption, the actress wrote, "11 years married today! A time when we had no money, less than 50 guests...opening wedding envelopes to pay for our reception." "A reminder of how far we've come together," she added.

203.title: Pune woman kills 4-month-old kitten, says, 'it used to make noise'
203.article_body: Pune Police have booked a woman for allegedly killing a four-month-old kitten. According to the police, she hit the kitten's head with a blunt object after it entered her house. The woman reportedly told the police that the kitten used to come to her house often and made "noise". Police registered the case after the woman's neighbour filed the complaint.

204.title: Cong burns effigies of Amitabh, Akshay Kumar for not protesting fuel price hikes
204.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress burnt the effigies of Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar for allegedly being selective in their criticism of fuel price hikes and inflation. "In 2012, these actors used to tweet against fuel price hikes and inflation...At that time, an LPG cylinder used to cost ₹300-400, while petrol and diesel was around ₹60/litre," said Congress MLA PC Sharma.

205.title: Ricky Gervais, 50 Cent support Will Smith after 10 year Oscar ban
205.article_body: After Will Smith was banned from attending Academy events for the next 10 years, Ricky Gervais and 50 Cent among others have tweeted in support of him. "Hopefully, he'll only do 6 years with good behaviour," Ricky tweeted. 50 Cent wrote, "This is too harsh...He can't come back till he 63 years old. And the lawsuit ain't even hit yet."

206.title: TMC leader says, 'We can blow up area in 10 mins'; Malviya shares video
206.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Saturday shared a video wherein a TMC leader purportedly said, "Don't worry we have so much stock of bombs and guns that we can blow up the whole area in 10 minutes." He claimed the comments were made by TMC's Deputy Pradhan Sakir Ahmad. "West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee is waiting to explode," Malviya wrote.

207.title: AAP lost deposits in UP, it'll lose in Himachal also: Anurag Thakur
207.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the BJP will retain power in Himachal Pradesh by winning the upcoming state Assembly elections. Further speaking about Aam Aadmi Party, Thakur said, "AAP has lost deposits in Uttar Pradesh and it will lose in Himachal Pradesh also." Notably, AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari joined BJP on Friday.

208.title: Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy: Kajal Aggarwal
208.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture from her maternity photoshoot, writing, "Preparing for motherhood can be beautiful but messy." The actress further wrote, "One moment you feel like you have everything under control, while the next moment, you're so drained." Kajal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu are expecting their first child together.

209.title: MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Bumrah well in IPL: Irfan
209.article_body: Irfan Pathan said MI know how to make a comeback after having lost three straight matches in IPL 2022. "In IPL 2015, they were in a similar situation...that team was a little different. This year, MI doesn't have a bowler who can support Jasprit Bumrah well. This is a major headache for...captain," he added. MI will face RCB today.

210.title: Don't expect Russia to be removed from UN Security Council: US
210.article_body: The White House on Friday said that it does not anticipate Russia to be suspended from the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Notably, Russia is among the five permanent members of the UNSC and has veto power. Earlier, Russia was suspended from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

211.title: A scene was cut off in a film, made my character look strange: Jacqueline
211.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez revealed that a filmmaker once cut her scene which made her character look very strange. Without naming the film, Jacqueline said her character had a quirk but the scene explaining it was chopped off. "A director friend came later and asked me about it and I said I have an explanation but it's too late," she added.

212.title: Imran not in his senses anymore, must be treated as psychopath: Nawaz Sharif's daughter
212.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Nawaz has tweeted, "One person who is not in his senses anymore cannot be allowed to wreak havoc & bring the entire country down." She added, "He shouldn't be treated as PM or ex-PM, he must be treated as a psychopath who just to save his own skin is holding the entire country hostage."

213.title: I have a great bonding with SRK, he's a great listener: Sonu Sood
213.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has said that he has a great bonding with actor Shah Rukh Khan, adding that the latter is a great listener. Sonu added that the two spent a lot of time together while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year'. "He really takes care of you as an elder brother, as a producer," Sonu said.

214.title: Russia expels 45 Polish diplomats in a tit-for-tat move
214.article_body: Russia has expelled 45 Polish embassy and consulate staff and declared them "persona non grata", the Russian Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Poland expelled the same number of Russian diplomats in March. Poland had said the Russian diplomats were suspected of working for Russian intelligence. Russia has given the diplomats time till April 13 to leave the country.

215.title: I don't know about the big day myself: Neetu on Ranbir-Alia's wedding
215.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, when asked about her actor-son Ranbir Kapoor's wedding to actress Alia Bhatt, told ETimes, "I would like to celebrate it and say it out loud. But kids today are different." She added, "I don't know about the big day myself, as both are very private people." She also said, "Alia and Ranbir are made for each other."

216.title: We've become debt-free, repaid ₹2,925 crore loans: Ruchi Soya
216.article_body: Edible oil major Ruchi Soya has said that it has repaid ₹2,925 crore loans to banks and has become a debt-free company. The money was paid to a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India. Baba Ramdev's Patanjali Ayurved-led Ruchi Soya has recently raised ₹4,300 crore through its follow-on public offer.

217.title: Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of MI: Harbhajan Singh
217.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav is the Shah Rukh Khan of the franchise, referring to his 'Main Hoon Na' celebration in IPL 2020. "When he first came he was a bit fat but Suryakumar has lost a lot of weight in the past few years, and worked a lot [on] his game," added Harbhajan.

218.title: Will take strict action: Yogi govt after UP CMO's Twitter account hacked
218.article_body: After the Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked, CM Yogi Adityanath-led state government said strict action will be taken against those responsible. The breach came to light when unidentified hackers published a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter" on the CMO's account. They also changed the account's profile picture.

219.title: Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since invasion began: Ukraine
219.article_body: Ukrainian officials have claimed that Russia has lost over 19,000 troops since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Officials said Russia has also lost 1,891 armoured personnel vehicles, 700 tanks and 135 helicopters. Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted that Russia had suffered "significant losses of troops" in what Russia calls a "special military operation" in Ukraine.

220.title: European Union to resume diplomatic presence in Kyiv
220.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday announced that it will resume its diplomatic presence in Kyiv. Notably, the EU's decision comes after a retreat by Russian forces from areas around the Ukrainian capital recently. The EU had moved its diplomatic mission to Poland after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 following months of tensions.

221.title: Govt websites hacked as Ukraine Prez addressed Parliament: Finland
221.article_body: Finland's government website and those of several ministries were hit by a cyberattack at the same time that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was giving a video address to the Parliament on Friday, the government said. However, the situation has been normalised, Finland's Foreign Ministry said. Finland on Friday also reported a violation of Finnish airspace by a Russian state aircraft.

222.title: Will bring the best content for people: Ayushmann on upcoming projects
222.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, while talking about his upcoming projects, said he is confident that he will be bringing the best content for people to watch in 2022. "I have always looked to handpick projects that are out of the ordinary," Ayushmann said. The actor will be seen in three upcoming films, titled, 'Anek', 'Doctor G' and 'Action Hero'.

223.title: Germany may reintroduce COVID-19 measures in fall: Health Minister
223.article_body: Health Minister Karl Lauterbach on Friday said Germany may reintroduce certain COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing in public in the fall when cases are expected to rise. German lawmakers on Thursday voted against imposing a COVID-19 vaccination mandate on people aged 60 and older. The mandate was supported by both German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Lauterbach.

224.title: Tom Holland buys Porsche Taycan Turbo S worth ₹2.13 cr, shares pic
224.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has purchased a Porsche Taycan Turbo S which is worth ₹2.13 crore. He took to Instagram to share a picture of the car, writing, "'Electric' Peter Kay. Thanks Porsche for helping me go electric." As per a report, Tom also owns an Audi RS7, Audi RS7 Sportback, Audi Q7, Audi R8 and Rolls Royce Cullinan Black Badge.

225.title: Four booked for gang-raping differently-abled woman in Gujarat
225.article_body: Police booked four men for allegedly gang-raping a woman in her late twenties, who is speech and hearing impaired, multiple times in Gujarat's Mehsana. The woman's son had informed his father about the incident, police said. When her husband confronted the accused, they threatened to kill the couple and their child and forced them to leave Mehsana, police added.

226.title: Sec 144 imposed after stones pelted at Shobha Yatra in Karnataka
226.article_body: After stones were allegedly pelted at the Rama Shobha Yatra procession on Friday night, prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 were imposed in Karnataka's Mulbagal.  According to the police, five people have been taken into custody till now. "As there was a disruption in the electricity supply, some miscreants may have taken advantage," Kolar SP D Devaraj said.

227.title: Central agencies looking into hoax bomb threat to B'luru schools: Min
227.article_body: After several schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via email, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra today said that central agencies are looking into the matter. Jnanendra added that police are trying to find out who was behind the hoax threat. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state.

228.title: UN seeks $80 million to prevent oil spill disaster off Yemen coast
228.article_body: The UN said it is seeking $80 million from donor nations to fund an emergency operation to remove a million barrels of crude oil from a tanker anchored off the coast of Yemen. An oil spill from the FSO Safer tanker "would unleash a massive ecological and humanitarian catastrophe", UN Resident and Humanitarian Coordinator for Yemen, David Gressly said.

229.title: BJP's personal agenda is to prioritise Hindi over other languages: HD Kumaraswamy
229.article_body: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah over his statement that Hindi should be an alternative to English. Kumaraswamy also accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing their "personal agendas" on citizens. "Central government...(is) actually trying to forcibly run their personal agendas. But they won't succeed. People will teach them a lesson," he said.

230.title: Used to sneak out silently when Happy New Year cast went to party: Sonu
230.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood in an interview has stated that people find it very difficult to take him to parties. The actor said that they were travelling while shooting 2014 film 'Happy New Year', Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone used to say, 'Let's go party'. "I used to sneak out silently. It's very difficult to party with me," Sonu added.

231.title: Odisha to establish hockey clubs in schools across all districts
231.article_body: Ahead of the FIH Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar, the Odisha government is all set to launch its 'Mo School Hockey Club' programme. The programme aims to establish a hockey club in at least one school of each district. There will be around 24-30 students in each wing of the club selected from Class 6 onwards, officials said.

232.title: Sebastian Vettel fined ₹4.12 lakh for riding scooter on Australian F1 track
232.article_body: Aston Martin driver Sebastian Vettel has been fined €5,000 (₹4.12 lakh) for riding a scooter on the Albert Park circuit following the conclusion of Free Practice 1 for the Australian Grand Prix on Friday. Vettel had borrowed the scooter from the marshals. The four-time champion was deemed to have broken Article 26.7 of the Sporting Regulations of Formula One.

233.title: Ram Charan to play double role in Shankar's 'RC15': Report
233.article_body: Actor Ram Charan will reportedly play a double role in Shankar Shanmugham's upcoming project tentatively titled 'RC15'. According to reports, the actor will be seen portraying the role of an officer and a student in the bilingual political drama. Written by Karthik Subbaraj, the film's music will be composed by S Thaman. It will also feature Kiara Advani.

234.title: Jamia ties up with digital online learning firm to impart skills to students
234.article_body: The Jamia Millia Islamia's placement cell has tied up with an online digital learning platform, IBM Skills Build-CSRBOX Foundation, to equip its students with essential technical skills. “The collaboration will facilitate the delivery of free digital learning to JMI students through the acquisition of essential skills like technical, professional and job readiness skills,” JMI said in a statement.

235.title: Chip undersupply to last until 2024: Volkswagen CFO
235.article_body: Volkswagen Chief Financial Officer Arno Antlitz has said that the supply of semiconductors is unlikely to completely meet the demands again until 2024. "The structural undersupply will likely only resolve itself in 2024," Antlitz said. He added that some issues might begin to ease towards 2022-end, with production returning to 2019 levels next year.

236.title: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
236.article_body: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."

237.title: NASA to resume crucial Artemis 1 Moon mission's 'wet dress rehearsal'
237.article_body: NASA will be resuming its 'wet dress rehearsal' for Artemis 1 Moon mission today. It began the rehearsal, a practice run of the most important prelaunch activities, last Friday. However, the attempt was suspended after a valve issue surfaced during tanking. The rehearsal includes a full countdown, loading the rocket's tanks with supercold propellant and draining the rocket tanks.

238.title: 'Mud volcano' erupts at a temple in Taiwan; video goes viral
238.article_body: A video of a 'mud volcano' that erupted at a temple in the Pingtung County of southern Taiwan has gone viral on social media platforms. The video showed the eruption spewed large amounts of mud and water above ground that flowed into surrounding roads and fields. The bursts reached as high as a one-storey building.

239.title: WMA writes to PM Modi, seeks solution against violence on doctors
239.article_body: The World Medical Association has written to PM Narendra Modi asking him to address violence against doctors in India. "Countering non-negligent treatment errors with prosecution...is not only unjust but will also have grave consequences," the letter read. "We observe an increasing rate of violence against [doctors]...This is a serious situation," said Dr Otmar Kloiber, WMA Secretary-General.

240.title: Plenty of unused COVID vaccine doses, won't buy fresh stock: Pune hospitals
240.article_body: Private hospitals in Pune have reportedly claimed that they have plenty of unused COVID-19 vaccine doses and are reluctant to order fresh stock. "We have 5,000-6,000 doses...and hardly 10 people are coming each day," Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said. "We will be ordering after we've exhausted our pending stock of 3,000 doses," an official at Jehangir Hospital said.

241.title: I was asked to send pictures without clothes: Ankit Siwach on casting couch
241.article_body: TV actor Ankit Siwach, who began his modelling career in Delhi 12 years ago, recently spoke about facing the casting couch. The actor admitted that coming from Meerut to Delhi was a "culture shock" for him, adding, "I was asked to send pictures without clothes." He also said, "I was asked to come to parties that weren't related to work."

242.title: Country didn't only love me, but it also hit me with shoes: Rahul
242.article_body: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Saturday commented that India not only gave him love but also hit him with shoes. "I thought why is this happening? And got the answer that the country wants to teach me...The country is telling me that you should learn, understand," he said. He made the comments at the launch of a book.

243.title: Many girls would relate to my character in 'Lost': Pia Bajpiee
243.article_body: Actress Pia Bajpiee while talking about her next film 'Lost' said many girls would relate to her character. "It touched a chord with me...She is powerful, ambitious and vulnerable at the same time," Pia added. She further said that working with director Aniruddha Roy Chowdhury was like being in an institute as she learned a lot from him.

244.title: J&K ex-minister Babu Singh, absconding in Hawala case, arrested
244.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir minister Jatinder Singh alias 'Babu Singh', the main accused in a Hawala racket case that was busted by the police last month, was arrested from Kathua on Saturday. According to Jammu SSP Chandan Kohli, Jatinder Singh is being brought to Jammu for interrogation in connection to the Hawala money which was meant for subversive activities.

245.title: They weren't leaked from school or anywhere: Abhishek on pics of daughter shared online
245.article_body: On being asked how safe he feels when his daughter Aaradhya's pictures circulate on the internet with some even leaked from school, Abhishek Bachchan said, "No, they were not leaked from the school or anywhere." He added, "You'll shoot her whenever she steps out of the house. It is what it is. There is no point analysing it."

246.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for Netflix's 'Guns & Gulaabs'
246.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has completed shooting for his upcoming Netflix project titled 'Guns & Gulaabs'. "This journey wouldn't have been the same without you guys," Rajkummar wrote on Instagram while posting a picture with directors Raj Nidimoru and Krishna DK. Produced by D2R Films, 'Guns & Gulaabs' will be Rajkummar Rao's first series with Netflix.

247.title: Teammate of Kohli for a long time, first time he's so relaxed: Karthik
247.article_body: RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said he has been a teammate of Virat Kohli for a long time, but this is the first time Kohli is so relaxed. "There is so much time on his hands, I'm able to have long conversations," added Karthik. "I am genuinely enjoying it," stated Karthik. RCB have won two out of three IPL 2022 matches.

248.title: Delhi likely to get respite from rising temp in next 2 days: IMD
248.article_body: IMD official RK Jenamani on Saturday said that Delhi is likely to get some respite from rising temperatures in the coming two days. According to IMD, the national capital on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year. The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal.

249.title: Supply of mangoes to Pune to increase after April 20: Report
249.article_body: The supply of mangoes to Pune city is expected to improve after April 20, a Hindustan Times report said citing a trader. Due to a decline in supply this year, the prices of Ratnagiri and Devgad Alphonso mangoes range from ₹1,200 to ₹2,500 a dozen. The prices of other varieties of mango range from ₹600 to ₹1,000 a dozen.

250.title: 3 feared drowned as boat carrying 11 capsizes in river Ganga in Bihar
250.article_body: Three persons are feared drowned after a boat capsized in river Ganga near Brahmchari ghat in Bihar's Patna on Saturday. According to local residents, the small country boat carrying 11 people capsized due to high waves and strong currents. Prima facie, it appears that the boat was unable to sustain the weight of its occupants, an SDRF official said.

251.title: 13 arrested for raising anti-national slogans in Srinagar mosque
251.article_body: A total of 13 people have been arrested by Srinagar Police in the case related to anti-national and provocative sloganeering in and around Jamia Masjid, police said on Saturday. A video that surfaced on social media purportedly showed men raising Azadi slogans in the mosque. This was the first congregational prayer held in the mosque in the month of Ramzan.

252.title: Baffled by SRH's decisions, Williamson should bat at no. 3: Harbhajan
252.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said he is baffled by SRH's decision making with captain Kane Williamson opening for the franchise in IPL 2022, rather than batting at number three position. "Williamson's best numbers have come in IPL as well as for New Zealand when he has batted at number three," added Harbhajan. SRH are yet to record a win in IPL 2022.

253.title: Illegal weapons supplier held with 4 pistols in Gurugram
253.article_body: Police arrested an illegal weapon supplier and seized four pistols from him near Gurugram's Sohna. Police said they tried to stop a car coming from Sohna but the driver did not pay heed. "We somehow stopped the car and found two men inside. One of them fled as soon as the car was stopped, the other was nabbed," police said.

254.title: Avoid travelling to Shanghai due to arbitrary COVID curbs: US to citizens
254.article_body: The US has asked citizens to reconsider travel to China and avoid visiting COVID-19 hotspots, including Shanghai, due to "arbitrary enforcement" of virus restrictions amid the country's worst outbreak. The COVID-19 curbs include "the risk of parents and children being separated", the US warned. The US also authorised the "voluntary departure" of non-essential staff from its consulate in Shanghai.

255.title: Dissolve Petroleum Ministry with immediate effect: Akhilesh Yadav
255.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre over hike in fuel price and said that Central government is "robbing the people". "If no government regulations...can control this reckless hike in fuel prices, and if everything is up to the market then what is the use of Petroleum Ministry? These ministries should be shut down with immediate effect," he tweeted.

256.title: I know Rashid Khan will get me out of the worst situations: Hardik
256.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya said he knows spinner Rashid Khan will help the team escape in the worst situations, adding that Rashid is his trump card. "I want batters to attack Rashid," stated Hardik. "He is an aggressive spinner which I don't see a lot," said Hardik. GT have recorded three wins in as many IPL 2022 matches.

257.title: India's 1st indigenous Polycentric Prosthetic Knee made: IIT M
257.article_body: IIT Madras researchers launched India's "first" indigenously made Polycentric Prosthetic Knee, 'Kadam'. It'll help above-knee amputees to walk with a comfortable gait. It's designed with high strength stainless steel and aluminium alloy along with hard chrome plated EN8 pins and high fatigue life polymer bushings. The Society for Biomedical Technology and Mobility India supported the development.

258.title: We sent message to Mayawati for alliance, offered CM post: Rahul
258.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that amid the Uttar Pradesh elections, his party had sent a message to BSP chief Mayawati for an alliance and offered her the CM post, but she didn't respond. He also claimed that she didn't fight for "Dalit voices" because of CBI, ED and Pegasus. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

259.title: Hope to have same equation with Alia I had with my mother-in-law: Neetu
259.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor has stated that her relationship with her mother-in-law Krishna Raj Kapoor was outstanding. She added that Krishna loved her more than her son late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor. "I hope to have the same equation with Alia because she is outstanding and amazing," Neetu said. Alia and Ranbir are reported to get married on April 14.

260.title: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh to star in Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather'
260.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has signed on to act in Chiranjeevi-starrer 'Godfather'. Chiranjeevi made the announcement on Twitter, adding that Jagannadh will be seen in a special role in the film. Helmed by Mohan Raja, 'Godfather' is the Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The film also stars Nayanthara and Satyadev Kancharana in key roles.

261.title: Russian air strikes to increase in Ukraine's south, east: UK
261.article_body: Russian air activity is expected to increase in Ukraine's south and east, the UK's Defence Ministry said. The ministry added that "Russia is continuing to hit Ukrainian non-combatants, such as those killed in yesterday's rocket strike on Kramatorsk railway station in eastern Ukraine". At least 52 people were reportedly killed and several others were injured in Friday's railway station attack.

262.title: Insomnia could increase the risk of type 2 diabetes: Study
262.article_body: According to a study, people with insomnia are at an increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes. Insomnia symptoms cause higher Hemoglobin A1C levels, indicating it plays a causal role in the condition. "Eating healthy balanced diet, being active, along with getting enough sleep, are all essential for...those at risk of, or living with, type 2 diabetes," a researcher said.

263.title: Mizoram has started issuing identity cards to Myanmar refugees: Official
263.article_body: Myanmar government has started issuing identity cards to refugees from Myanmar, a Home Department official said. "The cards will facilitate speedy...easier identification of refugees...prevent them from enrolling in the state's voters' list," the official added. A total of 29,532 Myanmarese refugees have sought shelter in Mizoram since the military takeover in February 2021, as per official data.

264.title: Covishield and Covaxin vaccine prices for private hospitals cut to ₹225 per dose
264.article_body: Serum Institute of India revised the price of Covishield vaccine for private hospitals from ₹600 to ₹225 per dose. Bharat Biotech also revised the price of Covaxin vaccine from ₹1,200 to ₹225 per dose for private hospitals. Earlier today, the Centre said, "Private COVID-19 vaccination centres can charge only up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination."

265.title: Can't be selfish to discuss Liverpool contract right now: Mo Salah
265.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has said that he can't be "selfish" to discuss his contract while the club is focused on winning trophies. "I can't be selfish and talk about my (contract)," Salah said. "We (Liverpool) are in the most important period...so I have to just talk about (Liverpool)," he added. Notably, Salah's contract expires in June 2023.

266.title: IIIT-Lucknow student gets ₹1.2 cr package with Amazon job, institute's highest-ever
266.article_body: A final year B.Tech student at Indian Institute of Information and Technology, Lucknow, has bagged the institute's highest-ever annual salary package of ₹1.2 crore. Abhijeet Dwivedi has been hired as a software development engineer for Amazon in Dublin, Ireland, TOI reported. "I saw several videos to prepare myself for the interview. Soft skills matter a lot," Dwivedi said.

267.title: Which players have hit a six off the last ball of the 20th over to win an IPL match?
267.article_body: GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia became the 10th cricketer to slam a six off last delivery to win an IPL match. Rohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Saurabh Tiwary, Dwayne Bravo, MS Dhoni, Mitchell Santner, Nicholas Pooran, Ravindra Jadeja and Srikar Bharat are the other nine batters to do so. Rohit did it thrice, against KKR (2009), PWI (2011) and Deccan Chargers (2012).

268.title: Go to India if you like it so much: Ex-Pak PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter to Imran Khan
268.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Nawaz Sharif's daughter Maryam Sharif has criticised Imran Khan for praising India. She tweeted, "Someone should tell a person who has gone mad after seeing this power gone that he has been expelled by his own party and no one else." She added, "If you like India so much then shift there and leave the life of Pakistan."

269.title: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passes away aged 94
269.article_body: Veteran Telugu actor M Balayya passed away at the age of 94 on Saturday morning. Balayya had made his debut as an actor with 'Ettuku Pai Ettu' in the year 1958 and acted in nearly 300 films. He also received the Gold Nandi Award from Andhra Pradesh government for his play 'Nalupu Telupu' which was later made into 'Chelleli Kapuram'.

270.title: Rahman shares poster on Tamil after Shah said Hindi should replace English
270.article_body: Composer AR Rahman has shared a poster titled 'Tamizhanangu' highlighting the significance of Tamil. The poster also has poet Bharathidasan's line 'Inba Thamizh Engal Urimai Sempayirukku Vaer' (Delightful Tamil is the root of the staple crop of our rights). This comes after Home Minister Amit Shah stated that Hindi should be an alternative to English for people from different states.

271.title: 69 police trainees hospitalised after having dinner at Maha training centre
271.article_body: As many as 69 police trainees from the Police Training Centre in Maharashtra's Dhule were hospitalised after they complained of stomach ache and vomiting. According to Dhule SP Pravinkumar Patil, it seems the trainees fell ill after having dinner. The SP added that the condition of the trainees is stable now and 29 of them have been kept under observation.

272.title: Sindhu, Srikanth lose in the semis at 2022 Korea Open
272.article_body: Third seed PV Sindhu lost in women's singles semi-final at 2022 Korea Open on Saturday. She was defeated by second seed An Seyoung of South Korea 21-14, 21-17 in 48 minutes. In men's singles semi-final, Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, lost to third seeded Jonatan Christie 19-21, 16-21 in 49 minutes. With this, India's campaign ended in the tournament.

273.title: 40-year-old neighbour kidnaps, rapes 6-year-old girl in Thane
273.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly abducted a six-year-old girl from his neighbour and raped her inside his home in Thane, a police official said. The accused, who is identified as Anwar Shaikh, fled from the spot after being confronted by neighbours, Inspector (Crime) Sunil Shinde said. Police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to nab the accused.

274.title: Dead shark in UK found to have meningitis in a 'world's first' case
274.article_body: A rare Greenland dead shark found washed up on a beach in the UK's Cornwall had meningitis, post mortem concluded, which scientists are calling the "world's first" such case. The female shark, thought to be around 100 years old, was found by walkers last month. The shark's brain was "discoloured and congested", while the fluid around the brain was cloudy.

275.title: Was born in centre of power but I don't have interest in it: Rahul
275.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was born in the "centre of power", but he "honestly" doesn't have an interest in it. He claimed that there're politicians who think about attaining power throughout the day, then sleep and repeat the cycle, while he tries to understand the country instead. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.

276.title: AAP was about to remove Anup Kesari on allegation of dirty acts against women: Sisodia
276.article_body: A day after AAP chief in Himachal Pradesh Anup Kesari joined BJP, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the party was about to remove him on the allegation of dirty acts against women. "The place of such people is in BJP only," Sisodia added. "The top leadership of the BJP is scared of AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal," Sisodia tweeted.

277.title: Police arrest 3 for stealing LPG gas from cylinders in Pune
277.article_body: Pune Police have recently arrested three people involved in pilfering LPG gas from cylinders and illegally selling it. A tempo, 31 full cylinders and six empty cylinders were seized from their possession. "The accused were found transferring...gas from cylinders and filling them into empty ones. We raided the premises and caught the accused red-handed," a senior police official said.

278.title: Austrian Chancellor Nehammer to visit Ukraine, meet Prez Zelenskyy
278.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer's office on Friday said he has set off on a one-day visit to Ukraine where he will meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "It is important that within the framework of our neutrality we stand by Ukraine on a humanitarian level as well as politically," Nehammer said. Although neutral, Austria has provided Ukraine with humanitarian aid.

279.title: EU chief offers Ukraine fast-track membership to European Union
279.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Friday offered Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy paperwork that will allow Ukraine to become a member of the European Union. "It will not be, as usual, a matter of years, but rather a matter of weeks," she said. Her visit to Ukraine is the first by top EU officials since Russia's invasion began.

280.title: Test blast at Noida's Supertech towers on Sunday, locals told to stay indoors
280.article_body: Ahead of the test explosion at Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A on Sunday, an advisory was issued asking residents of nearby societies to remain indoors from 2:15-2.45 pm. Traffic will remain suspended on the stretch for 30 minutes. "It'll be a...low-intensity blast to check the amount of explosives required for the main explosion," Emerald Society RWA president said.

281.title: Bottom-placed SRH to bowl first against winless CSK, playing XIs announced
281.article_body: SRH won the toss and elected to bowl first against CSK in their IPL 2022 clash. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Maheesh Theekshana replacing Dwaine Pretorius. SRH have included Shashank Singh and Marco Jansen in their playing XI. Both the teams are winless in the tournament, with SRH being last on the points table.

282.title: German Prez calls for probe into war crimes against Putin, Lavrov
282.article_body: German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Friday called for a war crimes tribunal against Russian President Vladimir Putin and Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. "Anyone who has responsibility for these crimes will have to explain themselves," Steinmeier said. "That includes soldiers. That includes military commanders. And of course also those that have the political responsibility," he added.

283.title: Employee steals Delhi employer’s bike over unpaid dues, demands ₹20,000
283.article_body: A 25-year-old man in Delhi's Nihal Vihar stole his employer's motorcycle and demanded ₹20,000 in exchange for returning it, police said. During interrogation, the accused, identified as Anoop Singh, disclosed that his employer refused to pay his pending dues, so he stole his bike to teach him a lesson and get his money back. He has been arrested, police said.

284.title: Goa CM Pramod Sawant expands his Cabinet by inducting 3 more ministers
284.article_body: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Saturday expanded his Cabinet by inducting three more MLAs as ministers. BJP MLAs Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phaldesai and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) MLA Sudin Madhav Dhavalikar took oath in the presence of CM Sawant. Goa Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai administered the oath of office to the three new ministers.

285.title: 1st all private crew to ISS carries US hospital mascot soft toy
285.article_body: The first all private crew to the space station, launched by SpaceX, carried a plush toy of 'Caramel', the mascot for the Montreal Children's Hospital Foundation, as its zero-g indicator. The crew selected Caramel as their indicator in part because of the mission's connection to the hospital. Caramel was earlier briefly mistaken for Disney's rabbit Thumper from Bambi.

286.title: Woman dragged on road while trying to resist snatching bid in Delhi
286.article_body: A 23-year-old woman was allegedly dragged on the road for a few metres while trying to stop three bike-borne men from snatching her handbag in Delhi's Mundka. One of the snatchers was caught by the public after the woman screamed for help, while the two others fled. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and are looking for the absconding suspects.

287.title: 110 arrested for protesting outside Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house
287.article_body: A total of 110 persons have been arrested in connection with the protest outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house on Friday. The employees of MSRTC protested, claiming he didn't do anything for their demand of merging the corporation with the state government. On Friday evening, 103 were arrested on charges of rioting, unlawful assembly, assault and criminal conspiracy.

288.title: Japan bans Russian coal imports, expels eight diplomats
288.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida on Friday announced the expulsion of eight Russian diplomats and a ban on Russian coal imports in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "Russia has repeatedly violated international humanitarian law by killing civilians and attacking nuclear power plants. These are unforgivable war crimes," Kishida added. Russia accounted for 11% of Japan's total coal imports in 2021.

289.title: Delhi HC dismisses plea moved by fugitive against extradition proceedings
289.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea moved by a fugitive accused seeking quashing of extradition proceedings. The petitioner is an accused in a rape case lodged in London in 2017. "This court is of the considered view...petition is premature," HC ruled. Extradition proceedings were initiated without due compliance with the Extradition Treaty between India and the UK, the petitioner's counsel said.

290.title: UK FM Sunak's wife Akshata to pay UK taxes on global earnings amid criticism
290.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak's India-born wife Akshata Murthy said she'll pay UK taxes on her global earnings following a row over her non-domicile status. Noting that her tax arrangements are "entirely legal", Murthy said, "I do this because I want to...I do not wish my tax status to be a distraction for my husband or to affect my family."

291.title: My husband Rishi was a full-time job, thaka dete the: Neetu
291.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor, speaking about the demise of her husband actor Rishi Kapoor, has said that she got back to work because she didn't know where her life would have gone. "My husband was a full-time job...Thaka dete the (He would tire me out)," she added. Neetu further said that even her children told her to get herself busy.

292.title: Pune man loses ₹17 lakh after being lured by 'Playboy' male escort job
292.article_body: Cyber fraudsters allegedly cheated a 27-year-old unemployed man of over ₹17 lakh on the pretext of giving him a job in a male escort service named 'Playboy', police said. The accused had promised the victim that he'll be paid ₹3,000 per hour and asked for 'license fees'. The victim reportedly paid ₹17 lakh using his deceased father's savings and FD.

293.title: Private centres can take up to ₹150 as service charge for COVID-19 booster dose: Govt
293.article_body: Union Health Secretary on Saturday said that the precaution dose will be of same vaccine which was used for administration of previous two doses and no fresh registrations would be required on CoWIN. Private vaccination centres can charge up to a maximum of ₹150 as service charge for vaccination over and above the cost of vaccine, the government added.

294.title: 3 teens die, 3 hospitalised after consuming poison in Bihar's Aurangabad
294.article_body: Three teenage girls died and three others were hospitalised after six friends consumed poison together in Bihar's Aurangabad on Friday. The girls had reportedly gone to the pond outside their village in the evening and consumed a poisonous substance in the field. They were rushed to a hospital when villagers spotted them. Police are investigating the reason behind the incident.

295.title: Stand up for refugees: Priyanka to world leaders in video amid Ukraine crisis
295.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to social media to make an appeal to the world leaders amid the Ukraine-Russia war. "World leaders, we need you to stand up for refugees around the world to ensure that they get the support they need now," the actress said. "We can't just stand by and watch. It's gone on too long," she added.

296.title: Same-sex couple in Maharashtra sign MoU for legal protection after harassment by family
296.article_body: A same-sex couple, comprising a 28-year-old woman and a 19-year-old woman, seeking validity for their relationship registered a notarised MoU in a Pune court to ensure protection from their families who are against their relationship. The family of the 19-year-old began to harass them and since February, they faced "serious threat to their lives", the couple's lawyer Vikas Shinde said.

297.title: Exercise can lower risk of getting bowel cancer: Research
297.article_body: According to research, exercising multiple times a week over an extended period of time can reduce the risk of developing bowel cancer. Cancer-fighting substances such as IL-6 are released into the bloodstream when a person exercises regularly, a researcher said. These substances interact with abnormal cells, repairing their DNA and reducing the growth of cancer, he added.

298.title: I accept and respect the decision: Will Smith on 10-year Oscars ban
298.article_body: Will Smith said, "I accept and respect the Academy's decision," after the actor was banned from attending the Oscars or other related events and programs for 10 years for slapping presenter Chris Rock. In a statement, the Academy had called Smith's behaviour "unacceptable and harmful". Smith had slapped Chris after he joked about his wife's Alopecia condition at the Oscars.

299.title: Lmaooo: Musk on Bezos-owned paper criticising his new role at Twitter
299.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "Lmaooo" in response to The Washington Post op-ed titled, 'Elon Musk's vision of 'free speech' will be bad for Twitter'. It said, "Musk's appointment to Twitter's board shows that we need regulation of social-media platforms to prevent rich people from controlling our channels of communication." World's second-richest man Jeff Bezos owns The Washington Post.

300.title: India's forex reserves fall by $11.173 billion in steepest weekly fall ever
300.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves slid by $11.173 billion to $606.475 billion in the week ended April 1, marking the steepest weekly fall ever, data from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. This is the fourth consecutive weekly fall in the country's forex reserves. The latest weekly decline in reserves was due to a plunge in foreign currency assets (FCAs).

301.title: 12-year-old girl raped in public toilet near Pune railway station
301.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly raped in a public toilet near Pune railway station. The accused has not been identified yet, police said. The girl's mother, who is a resident of an area near the toilet, said the incident took place when her daughter went to relieve herself at the toilet. Police have launched a search to arrest the accused.

302.title: Tesla may have to mine, refine lithium as its price is insane: Musk
302.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to lithium's rising price over the years, saying, "Price of lithium has gone to insane levels! Tesla might actually have to get into the mining and refining directly at scale, unless costs improve." "There is no shortage of the element itself, as lithium is almost everywhere...but pace of extraction/refinement is slow," Musk added

303.title: Govt reserves 25% defence procurement budget for domestic private industry
303.article_body: Ministry of Defence reserved ₹21,149 crore or 25% of the domestic capital acquisition budget for the domestic private industry to encourage the private sector to take part in defence production. This comes two months after India earmarked 68% of the capital procurement budget for the entire domestic industry. India allocated ₹5.25 lakh crore for military spending in this year's budget.

304.title: Wanted to hit sixes, nothing else in mind: Tewatia on 3-ball 13* vs PBKS
304.article_body: Reacting to his 3-ball 13* which helped GT chase down 19 runs in the final over against PBKS, all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he just wanted to hit sixes with nothing else in his mind. "The last [shot] was off the middle of the bat...I knew it was [a] six," added Tewatia. GT are unbeaten in IPL 2022 so far.

305.title: I tried to pull De Villiers and Kohli away at times, jokes Maxwell
305.article_body: Recalling IPL 2021, RCB batter Glenn Maxwell joked that he tried to pull AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli away at times, terming them as "two peas in a pod". "When De Villiers announced his retirement, it was a...shock," said Maxwell. "It was awesome to have a few drinks with De Villiers and discuss life," added Maxwell.

306.title: Museum on history of cartoon art set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University
306.article_body: A first-of-its-kind museum on cartoon art has been set up at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SSPU). Visitors can reportedly view the works of famous Indian cartoonists as well as a variety of cartoon art from across India, spread over 200 years. The biggest section is devoted to cartoons and illustrations done during the establishment of the 'British Raj', reports stated.

307.title: He reminds me of Kohli at his prime: Shastri on Gill's 59-ball 96
307.article_body: Talking about GT opener Shubman Gill's 96 off 59 balls at a strike rate of 162.71 in the win against PBKS, Ravi Shastri said Gill reminds him of Virat Kohli at his prime. "Gill batted beautifully again, really really beautifully," added Shastri. "People would love to pay money to watch him bat when in full flow," stated Shastri.

308.title: Gurugram man stabs mother for not helping him reconcile with his wife
308.article_body: The Gurugram police arrested a 44-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his 66-year-old mother to death. The accused Manish revealed that his wife had left home due to some personal dispute and he was trying hard to reconcile with her but his mother was not very keen on it and was pressuring him not to bring her back, the police said.

309.title: Kejriwal ignored and insulted us: Anup Kesari after joining BJP
309.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari criticised Arvind Kejriwal and accused him of "being ignorant" against AAP Himachal unit leaders during a roadshow in Mandi constituency. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state party workers when he came for a rally. In the hill state, AAP workers considered this ignorance as an insult and quit the party for self-respect," Kesari said.

310.title: Navi Mumbai student arrested for stocking, circulating child porn via Insta
310.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Navi Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly circulating and stocking child pornography via messages on Instagram, police said. The accused had allegedly created an account on Instagram under a fake identity for this purpose. Police have seized the accused's mobile phone, which contains several such videos, along with financial transactions related to the content.

311.title: Kidnapped Pune land dealer rescued from Nepal border in UP; 2 held
311.article_body: Two people were arrested and four others are absconding after a land dealer, who was kidnapped from Pune, was rescued from near India-Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh. The accused had kidnapped the dealer on March 24 after calling him under the pretext of paying for the land they'd purchased, police said. The accused had demanded ₹10 lakh ransom, police added.

312.title: AT&T's WarnerMedia, Discovery merge, become Warner Bros Discovery
312.article_body: AT&T WarnerMedia unit and Discovery have completed their merger and the combined entity will be called Warner Bros Discovery. The new firm's portfolio includes Discovery Channel, Warner Bros Entertainment, CNN, HBO, Cartoon Network, streaming services Discovery+ and HBO Max and franchises like 'Batman' and 'Harry Potter'. It'll start trading on Monday under the ticker symbol 'WBD'.

313.title: Delivery of blood samples by drones begins in Gurugram
313.article_body: A private diagnostics company began a pilot project in Gurugram to collect blood samples from hospitals using drones and deliver them to labs. The aim of using drones is to cut down on turnaround time and provide faster test reports. A four-day trial will take place in and around Gurugram to test the efficacy of the system, the officials said.

314.title: Saudi Arabia to allow 1 million Muslim pilgrims for Haj 2022
314.article_body: Saudi Arabia has said it'll allow one million people, from both inside and outside the kingdom, to attend the Haj pilgrimage this year, state media reported. Only people aged under 65 who have been vaccinated against COVID-19 will be allowed to take part, the Ministry of Haj said. Last year, the kingdom limited the annual Haj to 60,000 domestic participants.

315.title: Malaika Arora pens post on her accident, says 'Feels like a scene from a film'
315.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora took to Instagram to pen a post on her car accident which occurred last week. "Last few days and events that unfolded have been quite unbelievable. Thinking about it in retrospect feels like a scene from a film and not something that actually happened," she wrote. "I'm a fighter...I’ll be back before you know it!" she added.

316.title: How much did Congress earn and spend in FY21 as compared to FY20?
316.article_body: The income of Indian National Congress declined by over 58% in financial year 2020-21, down from ₹682.2 crore in the previous fiscal to ₹285.7 crore, according to its audit report submitted to Election Commission. The party's expenditure dipped from ₹998.15 crore in the previous fiscal year to ₹209 crore in FY 2021. Congress' income in FY19 stood at ₹918 crore.

317.title: Odisha govt engineer held over disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 cr
317.article_body: An assistant engineer, working in the Odisha Water Resources Department, was arrested for possessing disproportionate assets worth over ₹5 crore in Bhubaneswar, an officer said. The vigilance officials raided the engineer's house and seized over ₹2 crore in cash, the highest cash seizure in the history of Odisha Vigilance and 20 gold biscuits weighing around 580 grams, among other valuables.

318.title: B'luru police reunites boy who got lost with his parents in 6 hrs
318.article_body: Bengaluru's Yashavanthapura traffic police station tweeted that it helped reunite a boy who got lost in a crowd after locating his parents within six hours. The traffic police said that one of their personnel had spotted the boy who was in a "state of fear", gave him food and reassured him. The traffic police also shared pictures of the incident.

319.title: Yes, Alia-Ranbir's wedding is happening and I've been invited: Alia's half-brother
319.article_body: Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt in an interview with Bombay Times confirmed that the actress is getting married to actor Ranbir Kapoor. "Yes, the wedding is happening and I have been invited. I will be there for the ceremonies," he said. On welcoming Ranbir to the family, he said, "I haven't met Ranbir in the capacity of Alia's boyfriend."

320.title: 3 given 10 years imprisonment for attempting to rape woman in Guj
320.article_body: Three persons were sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment by a Rajkot court in Gujarat for attempting to gang-rape a woman. Two of the three convicts admitted they tried to rape the woman who had gone to fetch water from a village tap in May 2020. The third one, on the other hand, was recording the video, they confessed.

321.title: Boycott Muslim drivers for travel to Hindu temples: K'taka right-wing group
321.article_body: A right-wing outfit in Karnataka on Friday launched a campaign for a boycott on using Muslim cab drivers or tour operators for travelling, especially to Hindu temples and shrines. "We don't eat [non-vegetarian food] and taking someone who doesn't believe in our gods...would be a disrespect," a member of the outfit claimed. The outfit visited homes across the state.

322.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan skips parliament on trust vote day
322.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan was absent in the country's parliament, which commenced proceedings on Saturday to take up the trust vote against him. Reports said Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf may be trying to filibuster the vote by prolonging the debate to prevent the decision entirely, a tactic that originated in US in 1880s. Khan has been Pakistan's PM since 2018.

323.title: After US & UK, EU imposes sanctions on Putin's 2 daughters
323.article_body: The European Union announced new sanctions on 217 people, including Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova, over Ukraine. "We're not targeting ordinary Russians. We're targeting...Kremlin, the political, economic elites supporting Putin's war in Ukraine," EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said. Earlier, the US & UK sanctioned Putin's daughters.

324.title: Staff's health has dipped in 2 yrs: Zerodha CEO on weight loss challenge
324.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath shared "more context" over the firm's weight loss challenge for employees, saying the employees' average health levels have "dipped in the past 2 years". "As a company, the onus is to...nudge everyone on the team to think about their health," Kamath said. He has faced backlash for promising half month's pay to staff who lose weight.

325.title: Jharkhand HC issues notice to CM Hemant Soren for owning mining lease
325.article_body: Jharkhand High Court on Friday issued notice to CM Hemant Soren over a petition filed against him for owning a mining lease of a 0.88-acre area in capital Ranchi's Angara block and called it a "serious matter". Soren got the lease allegedly by misusing his position as the Minister for the Department of Mines, the petition alleged.

326.title: Players forced to wait on ground as IPL debutant Sudharsan takes toilet break, video goes viral
326.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing PBKS and GT players being forced to wait on ground as GT debutant Sai Sudharsan took a toilet break after eight overs. An over later, strategic time out was taken, which caused further delay in match proceedings. Sai Sudharsan scored 35 runs off 30 deliveries as GT won by six wickets.

327.title: US denies 'warning' India on Russian oil imports
327.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki denied that US Deputy NSA Daleep Singh delivered a warning to India over Russian oil imports during his visit. "I wouldn't characterise it as a warning, nor did we at the time," Psaki said. "It's the decision of each individual country, including India, to determine whether they're going to import Russian oil," she added.

328.title: COVID-19 XE variant detected in 67-year-old Mumbai man visiting Gujarat
328.article_body: The XE variant of COVID-19 has been detected in a 67-year-old man, who was visiting Gujarat's Vadodara from Mumbai. The patient had tested positive for coronavirus during his stay at a hotel on March 12. We are getting more details and trying to trace his close contacts, Manoj Aggarwal, the additional chief secretary of the state's health department, said.

329.title: Russia shuts Amnesty Int'l, other human rights organisation offices
329.article_body: Russia said it's revoking the registration of 15 foreign non-profit organisations, including Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch (HRW). The decision to shut the offices follows "the discovery of violations of the current legislation of the Russian Federation", Russia's Justice Ministry added. "There's little doubt the move was in response to our reporting on the war in Ukraine," HRW said.

330.title: Ready for talks with Maoists if they express faith in Constitution: Baghel
330.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said government is ready for talks with Maoists if they express faith in the Indian Constitution. According to state government data, Maoist-related violence has dipped from 479 incidents in 2017 to 226 in 2021. While acknowledging the decrease, Baghel added, "We want peace and normalcy to return to Bastar and...make...efforts in this direction."

331.title: Sisodia to visit Gujarat schools to 'inspect' BJP's work in education sector
331.article_body: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said that he will be visiting Gujarat on Monday for an "inspection" of the state's government schools to know about BJP's work in the sector for the past 27 years. This comes after Gujarat Minister Jitu Vaghani said that those who are unhappy with Gujarat's education system should move to other states or countries.

332.title: Cult leader, who raped women for 30 years in London home and scared them with robot, dies
332.article_body: Aravindan Balakrishnan, a Maoist cult leader who imprisoned women for 30 years in his south London house and raped them, died in jail aged 81. Balakrishnan was convicted of a number of offences, including child cruelty, false imprisonment and assault. He used to terrify his prisoners with a made-up robot he called 'Jackie' which he claimed could read their minds.

333.title: New COVID-19 wave is sweeping across Europe: UN chief
333.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Friday said, "We're seeing 1.5 million new (COVID-19) cases each day. Large outbreaks are spreading in Asia. A new wave is sweeping across Europe." Guterres added that the next variant isn't a question of "if" but of "when". "And with new variants emerging every four months on average, time is of the essence," Guterres stated.

334.title: Hyderabad police arrest 4 people, seize 315 gm of hash oil
334.article_body: Hyderabad City Police arrested four people and seized 315 grams of hash oil from them. The accused were reportedly involved in procuring hash oil and selling them to needy customers. The Bowenpally Police, based on a tip-off, arrested the accused near Ganga Putra Sangam on Thursday. They also recovered two bikes and ₹15,000 cash from the accused.

335.title: Guj temple invites over 100 Muslim residents to offer namaz, break Ramzan fast
335.article_body: Over 100 Muslim residents of Dalvana village in Gujarat were invited to offer namaz and break their fast during Ramzan on the premises of Varanda Vir Maharaj Mandir on Friday evening. A priest at the 1,200-year-old temple said this was the first time the temple premises were opened for Muslim residents. "We've always believed in co-existence and brotherhood," he added.

336.title: Lightning strikes due to unseasonal rains kill 2 in MP; 12 injured
336.article_body: Two people were killed and 12 others were injured in separate incidents of lightning strikes due to unseasonal rains and thunderstorms in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni on Friday, an official said. A district administration official told PTI that a sudden change in the weather had occurred between 5pm and 6pm. A 58-year-old man and a 16-year-old boy are the two deceased.

337.title: Around 87,000 family cards issued to sex workers in TN: State minsiter
337.article_body: The State Minister for Food and Civil Supplies R Sakkarapani has said that 86,986 Smart Family (Ration) Cards have been issued to sex workers across Tamil Nadu. He also said that the Tamil Nadu Government has provided 2,429 family cards to transgenders till March 21, 2022. Notably, the state government has deleted 1,98,264 bogus ration cards, he said.

338.title: Baffled to not see any yorker: Jaffer on Odean's 19-run final over
338.article_body: Discussing PBKS all-rounder Odean Smith conceding 19 runs in the final over against GT, Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he was baffled to not see Odean bowl a single yorker. An overthrow by Odean brought Rahul Tewatia on strike, who hit two sixes off the final two deliveries, with 12 runs needed to win. GT defeated PBKS by six wickets.

339.title: India beat Korea 3-0 in junior women's hockey World Cup quarter-final
339.article_body: India defeated Korea 3-0 in the quarter-final match of the junior women's hockey World Cup in Potchefstroom on Friday. Lalrindiki, Mumtaz Khan and Sangita Kumari scored the goals for India. Mumtaz was adjudged as the 'Player of the Match'. India will now face the Netherlands in the semi-final on Sunday.

340.title: Bitcoin makes up 60% of my liquid portfolio: Mexican billionaire
340.article_body: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego at a conference revealed that Bitcoin and Bitcoin equities make up 60% of his liquid portfolio, adding the remaining 40% is in hard-asset stocks like oil and gas and gold miners. He said he doesn't have any bonds. "Bond investment is a terrible investment. I wouldn't touch a bond with a 10-foot pole," Ricardo added.

341.title: Parties against RSS, PM Modi should come together: Rahul Gandhi
341.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against PM Narendra Modi, RSS and what should be the framework of it. "The BJP thinks that by spreading hatred or by beating up people, economy can be improved," Gandhi added. "We have to bring people together. Our tradition of brotherhood must be restored," Gandhi further said.

342.title: 7 injured as fire breaks out in parking area in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar
342.article_body: At least seven people suffered minor burn injuries after a fire broke out in the parking area of lane number 13 in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar on Saturday, fire department officers said. Three motorcycles and two scooters were gutted, and the fire spread quickly towards a house, officers added. "It's suspected...short circuit in a motor caused the fire," an official said.

343.title: Cong denied permission to hold protest in Guj, police cites 'anti-govt slogans'
343.article_body: Congress was denied permission by police to hold a protest against "rising prices" and "unemployment" at Bahumali Bhavan Chowk in Gujarat's Rajkot. DCP Praveen Kumar cited the spread of COVID-19 and the possibility of raising anti-government slogans as the reasons for denying permission. Meanwhile, Congress alleged that the police is "acting as a tool in the hands of the BJP".

344.title: Himachal road transport bus skids off road, hits tree near Shimla; 4 injured
344.article_body: Four persons sustained injuries after a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus skidded off the road and crashed into a tree near Chaili village on the outskirts of Shimla. As per reports, the accident took place due to speeding. The injured persons, including the driver and conductor of the bus, were rushed to Indira Gandhi Medical College (IGMC) for treatment.

345.title: Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations: Russel Arnold
345.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said GT captain Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations, adding that there is a lot more to come from Hardik. "If he plays more balls, scores more runs...quietly gets his strike rate up and sets himself up for the death overs...I think he will be more destructive," added Russel.

346.title: Road accident victim's family gets over ₹ 35 lakh compensation in Punjab
346.article_body: The family of a 35-year-old man, who was killed after a truck hit his car near Punjab's Zirakpur in 2018, has been awarded a compensation of ₹35,35,400 lakh by Chandigarh's Motor Accident Claims Tribunal. The truck driver, owner and insurer had denied the petition. But the tribunal allowed the claim and awarded compensation to the victim's wife, child and parents.

347.title: Still 2 years younger for it: Amit Mishra to fan saying 'Sir, please come to CSK'
347.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra, who went unsold in IPL mega auction, took to Twitter to respond to a fan who had requested him to join CSK. "Sorry mate, still two years younger for it," the 39-year-old cricketer replied. Notably, in last few IPL seasons, CSK's average age was one of the highest, with fans terming the team as 'Dad's Army'.

348.title: If Rahul Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk: Kaif
348.article_body: Reacting to GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia's 13* off three balls against PBKS which included consecutive sixes with 12 runs needed off two balls, Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "If Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk". "Need Tewatia's statue in PBKS dugout," read Virender Sehwag's tweet. Irfan Pathan jokingly enquired on Twitter if Tewatia has some issue against PBKS.

349.title: They have a lot of problems: Harbhajan on CSK's worst start to IPL season
349.article_body: Talking about CSK recording their worst start in an IPL season, Harbhajan Singh said there are a lot of problems with the team which is why they have lost their first three IPL 2022 matches.
