"They do not have someone like Deepak Chahar, who can give them early wickets with the new ball," added Harbhajan.

350.title: Karnataka minister Eshwarappa, BJP corporator booked for hate speech
350.article_body: Karnataka Police has lodged an FIR against state minister KS Eshwarappa and BJP corporator Channabasappa on charges of making provocative statements following the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Shivamogga. The complainant, who is a local resident, claimed that because of Eshwarappa's communal incitement and statements of provocation, Shivamogga witnessed violence after Harsha's murder.

351.title: We will never let Hindi be our national language: Siddaramaiah
351.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said that as a Kannadiga, he took "strong offence" to Union Minister Amit Shah urging people to talk in Hindi. He added, "Hindi isn't our national language and we will never let it...be." Earlier, Shah said that people in different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English.

352.title: Court dismisses Khalid Saifi's bail plea in 2020 Delhi riots case
352.article_body: A Delhi court rejected UAPA-accused and United Against Hate founder Khalid Saifi's bail plea in connection with a 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. Saifi had connectivity with other accused and their cumulative role must be seen to comprehend the entire conspiracy, the court said. There was no evidence he gave a provocative speech to instigate anyone, Saifi's lawyer said.

353.title: Against the Constitution: TMC MP on Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark
353.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy criticised Amit Shah's remark that "people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English" and said that imposing Hindi in non-Hindi speaking states is "against" the Constitution. "If BJP forcibly wants to impose Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states then it will be protested and resisted. Even Nehru said that Hindi won't be imposed," Roy added.

354.title: Binance ready to follow sanctions on Russian officials: Ukraine
354.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has confirmed the "readiness to follow the sanctions policy on the Russian officials involved in military aggression", Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said. "During the call with Changpeng Zhao agreed on verifying their Ukrainian users," Fedorov added. Earlier in February, Fedorov called on major crypto exchanges to block Russian users' addresses.

355.title: Conflict in Ukraine's Donbas region could be knife fight: US
355.article_body: Eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, held by rebels, is becoming the "main scene of battle" after Russia failed to take the capital Kyiv, US Defense Department warned. Conflict in Donbas could be a "knife fight" as both sides are familiar with the terrain, population centres and access routes, a US defense official said. The fight could be "very bloody", official added.

356.title: Accused bite, assault Mumbai Police constables while resisting arrest
356.article_body: Three constables of Mumbai Police were injured after an accused and his accomplice, who were being escorted to the police station on Thursday, allegedly assaulted them. One of the accused, bit a constable's hand, whereas the other tore the uniform of another constable while trying to flee. However, the police overpowered them and brought them to police station.

357.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get engaged again, 18 years after their failed engagement
357.article_body: Singer-actor Jennifer Lopez and actor Ben Affleck are engaged once again. The 52-year-old shared a video of herself crying and looking at her engagement ring on Friday night on her official website. This comes 18 years after their first engagement had failed. Jennifer and Affleck had reunited last year, with Jennifer making the relationship public on her 52nd birthday.

358.title: Parliament can stop NGOs from receiving foreign funds: SC
358.article_body: Upholding the amendments in the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA), 2010, Supreme Court said that Parliament can stop non-governmental organisations (NGOs) from receiving foreign donations. "Receiving foreign donations cannot be an absolute or even a vested right," it added. "The foreign aid can create the presence of a foreign contributor...influence the country's policies," SC stated.

359.title: Pune woman kills husband, hangs body to pass off as suicide; held
359.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has been arrested in Pune for allegedly strangling her 44-year-old husband to death and then hanging his body to pass it off as suicide. The police questioned the woman and family after an autopsy revealed that the deceased was strangled. The woman confessed to the crime and claimed she'd done so due to her husband's constant harassment.

360.title: Conspiracy: Karnataka CM on hoax bomb threat at Bengaluru schools
360.article_body: After multiple schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via emails, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state. He added that police should "consider these cases seriously". A police officer said that the hoax bomb threats coincide with exams and they'd received similar hoax threats before during exams.

361.title: 33 students of law university in Gujarat test COVID-19 positive in last 2 days
361.article_body: As many as 25 students of Gujarat National Law University in Gujarat's Gandhinagar tested positive for COVID-19 on Friday, taking the tally of infected students to 33 since Thursday. Following this, Gandhinagar Municipal Corporation (GMC) has declared the campus a containment zone. "We have suspended offline classes. From Monday, classes will be held online," a university official said.

362.title: Russian missile that killed 52 at Ukraine station had 'for the children' written on it
362.article_body: A missile that struck a train station in Ukraine's Kramatorsk and killed 52 people, including five children, had the words "for the children" painted on it in Russian. Ukraine's Defence Ministry described it as "taking bestial brutality and moral depravity to the next level". The phrase translated as a message that the missile was sent in vengeance for children.

363.title: LSG look like they will struggle every time on paper: Graeme Smith
363.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said he thinks LSG are going to struggle every time he looks at their IPL 2022 squad on paper. "Their bowling attack is not outstanding on paper," added Smith. "But they are actually playing well as a team," stated Smith. LSG have won three out of their four IPL 2022 matches played so far.

364.title: 2 force-feed cycle tube solution to children in Guj to push them into begging
364.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly force-feeding 'cycle tube solution' to around seven children, aged between seven and 12, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad in order to force them into street begging. The accused used to force a 16-year-old boy from Uttarakhand to sell drugs to the children and beat him up if he failed to provide them with sufficient money.

365.title: Fire at factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area, 6 firefighters injured
365.article_body: Six firefighters were injured while trying to douse the fire that broke out at a factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area on Saturday.  All the injured firefighters were rushed to B L Kapoor Hospital. The fire was reportedly caused due to blast in LPG cylinders at 4:45 am. Ten fire tenders were deployed to bring the fire under control.

366.title: Pic of Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat vs GT goes viral
366.article_body: A picture of PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat against GT has gone viral on social media. Smith conceded 19 runs off the last overs, including 12 runs off the last two deliveries, as GT won by six wickets. "The last over could have been anyone's game," Agarwal said after the match.

367.title: RPF constable walks 4 kms on Mumbai's railway tracks to search commuter's phone
367.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable walked more than four kilometres on live railway tracks in WR's Mumbai division to look for newly purchased mobile phone of a traveller. The mobile phone of Deen Mohammed Qureshi, who was travelling on Dehradun Express, fell between Saphale and Vaitarna stations. Qureshi reached Saphale station at around 1 am to search his phone.

368.title: British, French divers rescued in Malaysia after over 2 days at sea
368.article_body: A French woman and a British man who disappeared while diving off the coast of Malaysia on Wednesday noon were found safe on Saturday, police said. Rescuers are still searching for Briton Adrian Chesters' 14-year-old son, who also went missing. The boat operator who took them to the dive site has been detained after testing positive for drugs, police added.

369.title: Which players have hit 2 sixes to win an IPL match with 12 runs needed off last 2 balls?
369.article_body: With 12 runs needed off last two deliveries, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia smashed two sixes off Odean Smith to help his team defeat PBKS (formerly KXIP) in their IPL encounter. MS Dhoni is the only other player to have smashed two consecutive sixes on last two balls to win an IPL match. He had done so against PBKS in 2016.

370.title: Jharkhand govt extends time-limit for Ram Navami processions till 10 pm
370.article_body: The Jharkhand government has extended the time-limit for religious processions till 10 pm, in view of demands from various Ram Navami puja committees and political parties. Earlier on March 30, the state government had permitted the processions till 6 pm. State Health minister Banna Gupta had met CM Hemant Soren on Thursday and requested him to extend the time limit.

371.title: Pant's strike rate an issue, strong finish never came against LSG: Smith
371.article_body: Discussing DC captain Rishabh Pant's 39* off 36 balls at a strike rate of 108.33 in their loss against LSG, ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said Pant's strike rate is an issue. "The strong finish never came. DC needed to get...a total of 170-180," added Smith. LSG defeated DC by six wickets after being handed a target of 150 runs.

372.title: Amazon calls for new election after workers vote for 1st US union
372.article_body: Amazon has called for an election re-run after its NYC warehouse workers voted to create the company's first US union. It has accused the Amazon Labor Union (ALU) of intimidating workers and distributing marijuana to gain votes in its favour. "We want our employees to have their voices heard, and in this case, that didn't happen," an Amazon spokesperson said.

373.title: Hyd Police Commissioner rewards officers for Mahesh Bank hack probe
373.article_body: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand rewarded 69 Cyber Crime team members for investigating the Mahesh Bank hack case, involving the illegal transfer of ₹12.48 crore. Further, 28 officers of various police stations were also honoured for their performance on Friday. The officers were rewarded on the basis of technical expertise, responsiveness, swift investigation and detection of cases.

374.title: 19-yr-old kills self in Chandigarh, parents allege harassment by friends
374.article_body: A 19-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide at his friend's paying guest (PG) room in Chandigarh. The deceased's parents have alleged that he was being harassed by other boys in the PG. His parents claimed the boys had recorded a video of him apologising to a girl for sexually harassing her in sleep and circulated it among his family members.

375.title: Hindus reject it: Tharoor on mahant's rape threat to Muslim women
375.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to the video of a Hindu mahant threatening to publicly rape Muslim women, saying, "The vast majority of Hindus reject and disown such elements." He added that as a Hindu, he can tell his Muslim friends that "thugs" like this don't represent Hindus just like an Islamic State extremist doesn't represent them.

376.title: EC transfers 2 police officers four days ahead of Asansol by-polls
376.article_body: Election Commission on Friday transferred two police officers of Asansol Durgapur Commissionerate, ahead of Asansol by-polls to be held on April 12. Abhijit Chatterjee, inspector in-charge of Asansol South Police Station, and Sanjib De of Jamuria Police Station were transferred out. The Asansol Lok Sabha seat fell vacant after former MP Babul Supriyo quit BJP last year to join TMC.

377.title: UP jails to play 'Gayatri Mantra' for inmates' peace of mind: Min
377.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Jail Dharmveer Prajapati on Friday announced that the 'Gayatri Mantra' and 'Mahamrityunjaya Mantra' will be played at the prisons across the state to provide inmates with "peace of mind". He also called for the organisation of sermons by "sants and mahants" at jails to "create a better atmosphere for prisoners".

378.title: AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, 2 others join BJP
378.article_body: Anup Kesari, president of Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Himachal Pradesh unit, along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Unna chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state AAP workers when he came for a rally...they considered this ignorance...quit for self-respect," Kesari said. "Only Kejriwal...Bhagwant Mann participated in the roadshow," Singh said.

379.title: Punjab govt failed to maintain law and order, regulate sand prices: Sidhu
379.article_body: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said that the state government is "failing" to maintain law and order situation and regulate the sand prices in Punjab. "Only announcements are being made...no notification regarding any announcement has been issued so far. The price of electricity is also likely to increase from the next month," he said.

380.title: 7 arrested for dancing to music on roof of moving cars in Maha's Nagpur
380.article_body: As many as seven persons were arrested for allegedly dancing to music on the roof of moving cars in Sadar area of Maharashtra's Nagpur, a police officer said. The matter came to light when a video of the alleged incident went viral on social media, he added. A total of five cars have been seized so far.

381.title: Sonam-Anand's Delhi residence robbed; cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore stolen: Report
381.article_body: Actor Sonam Ahuja and Anand Ahuja's Delhi residence was robbed and cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore was stolen, as per a report. In a police complaint lodged on February 23, Anand's grandmother Sarla claimed that she got to know of the theft on February 11 when she checked her cupboards for jewellery and cash, the report added.

382.title: Moderna recalls 7,64,900 COVID-19 vaccine doses over contamination in Europe
382.article_body: Moderna has said it is recalling 7,64,900 doses of its COVID-19 vaccine made by its contract manufacturer Rovi after a vial was found contaminated. No safety issues have been identified in the lots that were distributed in Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain and Sweden in January, Moderna added. Moderna was recalling the whole lot out of "an abundance of caution".

383.title: India declares 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed's son a designated terrorist
383.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has issued a notification declaring Hafiz Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Mohammad Saeed, as a designated terrorist. "Hafiz Talha Saeed has been actively involved in recruitment, fund collection, planning and executing attacks by...LeT in India and Indian interests in Afghanistan," MHA said. His father had masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.

384.title: They're being misled: Pawar as MSRTC employees protest outside his house
384.article_body: After over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday, he said that they are being misled. "ST employees and we have a very old relationship, in the last 40-50 years I've not missed any session with them," Pawar added. Notably, police arrested MSRTC employees' leader Gunaratna Sadavarte.

385.title: Punjab to set up 333 urban wellness centres: Health Minister
385.article_body: Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla on Friday announced Punjab government will set up 333 urban wellness centres in urban and semi-urban areas across the state. "The government will be utilising public buildings...rest of infrastructure, including machines and laboratories will be provided by the department," Singla said. "A special fund will be allocated in the budget for this project," he added.

386.title: 1,150 new COVID-19 cases, 83 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours
386.article_body: India reported 1,150 new COVID-19 cases and 83 new deaths in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,365. The death toll due to COVID-19 in India has risen to 5,21,656. Kerala has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases in the country at 3,190, followed by Karnataka (1,501 cases).

387.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian gunman who killed 3 people in a bar
387.article_body: Israeli security forces on Friday hunted down and killed a Palestinian man who had opened fire into a crowded bar in Tel Aviv on Thursday, killing three people and injuring several others. The gunman, identified as a 28-year-old from Jenin, was reportedly in Israel without a permit. It was the fourth deadly attack in Israel by Palestinians in three weeks.

388.title: UP CMO's Twitter account briefly hacked, profile pic changed to 'Bored Ape'
388.article_body: The Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked on Saturday. The breach came to light when unknown hackers used the account to publish a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter". Additionally, the profile picture of the account was also changed to 'Bored Ape' and the location was changed to 'Metaverse'.

389.title: Macron calls Polish PM 'far-right anti-Semite' amid Putin talks row
389.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron has called Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki "a far-right anti-Semite who bans LGBT people". This came after Morawiecki criticised his phone calls with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the Ukraine invasion. The Polish PM had compared Macron's efforts to negotiating with Hitler. Poland has summoned the French ambassador to Warsaw over Macron's comments.

390.title: 250 Marathi medium educated teachers denied job in BMC English schools
390.article_body: Around 250 teachers who have studied in Marathi medium have been protesting for 150 days at Mumbai's Azad Maidan against being denied jobs in BMC English schools. BMC is contradicting itself by asking schools to put up their names in Marathi letters on one hand and denying them jobs over their medium of instruction on the other, the protesters said.

391.title: Tesla, Jack Dorsey's Block to mine Bitcoin using solar power in US
391.article_body: Tesla, Twitter Founder Jack Dorsey's Block and blockchain company Blockstream will together mine Bitcoin using solar power in Texas, Blockstream CEO Adam Back said. Tesla's 3.8 megawatt solar PV array and 12 megawatt-hour Megapack will power the facility. The project will have a publicly available dashboard showing real-time metrics of its performance, including power output and Bitcoin mined.

392.title: K'taka CM inaugurates Sanjeevini SARAS fair in B'luru; buys sarees
392.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday inaugurated the Sanjeevini SARAS fair at the campus of Bengaluru's National College Basavanagudi. Bommai also purchased sarees from the various self-help groups at the fair, which was organised by Karnataka's entrepreneurship and livelihood department. About 300 stalls that were set up at the fair, displayed the work of women from across the country.

393.title: Pune to see day temperatures around 40°C till Apr 14, rain unlikely in coming days: IMD
393.article_body: The day temperatures in Pune will continue to hover around 40 degrees Celsius till April 14, according to the IMD. "There's no chance of rain in Pune in the coming few days. There will be partly cloudy conditions for the next 48 hours, after which the sky will be clear," head of the weather forecasting department at IMD Pune said.

394.title: Pune police file FIR as 13 cheated of ₹2.53 cr in admissions scam
394.article_body: Pune's Yerwada police station has filed an FIR after about 13 people were cheated of ₹2.53 crore by a group of men under the pretext of getting admission at a medical college in Nashik. This comes after one of the 13 people filed a complaint claiming that the accused took ₹30.72 lakh and promised his child's admission to the college.

395.title: 2 held at Amritsar airport for smuggling 10 kg gold from Sharjah
395.article_body: Two persons were arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) at Amritsar airport on Tuesday for smuggling gold from Sharjah (UAE). They recovered 10 kg of gold worth around ₹1.9 crore from them that was hidden in their clothes and headgear to evade customs duty. The accused are residents of Jalandhar and had visited UAE on a tourist visa.

396.title: Over 10 shanties gutted as fire breaks out at slum cluster in Gurugram
396.article_body: Over 10 shanties were gutted after a fire broke out at a slum cluster in Gurugram's Sector 74 on the Southern Peripheral Road on Friday evening, officials said. No casualties were reported, officials added. The fire had spread across an area of over 1.5 acres due to plastic and polythene material that had been collected at the cluster, officials stated.

397.title: 4-foot-long spectacled cobra rescued from Andheri
397.article_body: A four-foot-long spectacled cobra was rescued by Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare (RAWW) from Mumbai's Andheri around midnight on Thursday. The venomous cobra was spotted behind a water tank in a house inhabited by nearly 10 labourers. According to RAWW member Sahil Vichare, the house is a part of slum area, thus making it easy for the cobra to enter.

398.title: Will Smith banned from attending Oscars for 10 years
398.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been banned from attending Oscars and other Academy events for 10 years after he slapped Chris Rock at Oscars 2022 ceremony. In a statement, the Academy said the 94th Oscars had been "overshadowed by the unacceptable and harmful behaviour" exhibited by Smith. It added that banning Smith was aimed at protecting performers and guests.

399.title: Delhi sees hottest day of year so far with maximum temperature at 41.6°C
399.article_body: Amid a 'severe heatwave', Delhi on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal. IMD has issued an orange alert, warning of a 'severe heatwave' in Delhi on Saturday too.

400.title: He knows he won't win so decided to campaign for India? Pak PM Imran's ex-wife
400.article_body: After Pakistan PM Imran Khan praised India ahead of a trust vote, his ex-wife Reham Khan said, "He knows he can't win again so decided to campaign for India? Khudaar qaum suddenly!!" Imran had said, "Indians are khuddar quam (very self-respecting people). No superpower can dictate terms to India." "Pakistan gets used as...tissue paper and thrown away," he added.

401.title: Bengaluru bans sale of meat on Rama Navami, official says routine order
401.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body issued an order prohibiting animal slaughter and sale of meat on Rama Navami on April 10. Every year there is a blanket ban on sale of meat and animal slaughter on Rama Navami and such bans are imposed on at least eight days a year on events like Gandhi Jayanti, Sarvodaya Day, a BBMP official said.
